p: Phytochemical analysis of crude methanolic extract of bark as well as its various organic fractions showed that it is rich in alkaloids, phenols, and saponins, whereas reducing sugars, flavonoids, tannins, and triterpenoids are also present.[ 19] Secondary metabolites and their derivatives possess different biological activities; for example, flavonoids provide protection against cancer, heart attack, asthma, and Alzheimerâ€™s diseases.[ 23 24 25]
